headline: Roast Potatoes
description: Learn how long to bake potatoes at 450°F with this simple and delicious recipe for creamy, oven-roasted baby red potatoes seasoned with rosemary.
name: Roast Potatoes
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds red potatoes, cut into quarters

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (250 degrees C) and gather all ingredients.
Place potatoes in a large roasting pan and toss with oil, salt, pepper, and rosemary until evenly coated.
Spread out potatoes in a single layer.
Bake, stirring occasionally, in the preheated oven until tender, about 20 minutes. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: It was good
Very yummy. Quartered potatoes take 40-50 minutes, not 20. Either they were pre-boiled (like others suggested) or cut into much smaller pieces than quarters (as one of the pictures suggest).
Really love these potatoes!! Easy, crispy and delicious!!

This is such a simple recipe yet it makes a good side dish for any meal! The only thing I would do differently next time is to spray the roasting pan to prevent the potatoes from sticking. Otherwise a good recipe!
Made these potatoes for the first time and loved ‘em!
Wonderful flavor and taste. Made as recipe suggested

These potatoes turned out so good! Very easy to make with the only real work being chopping up the potatoes, the rest was just waiting for them to cook. Simple ingredients that are pantry staples so no need to buy anything extra. Instead of roasting in 20 minutes it took about 35, but otherwise turned out great. Thank you for sharing your recipe, KIY!
I had to use a baking sheet since my pan was in use. It still worked well though the potatoes were not as crispy as they were when I used the pan.
The whole family eats with out complaint! Perfect.
Yummmm!!!!!
Very easy and tasty added fresh garlic ?? . Hubby was happy

Simple and delicious potatoes! Nothing too adventurous or creative here; just hearty, strong flavors that won't take away from the taste of whatever your main course is. Quick and easy to make as well!

Love these! Quick, easy, and a crowd pleaser. Perfect to pair with a bbq or fish. Nice to bring to a party if asked for a side dish. 
I make these all the time now!

You had me at easy and delicious! Thanks for a killer recipe! I did add garlic powder, Italian seasoning and onion salt! Everyone raved about these roasted potatoes! 30 minutes was a perfect result for me! Thanks !
This is the best way to use up my potatoes...recommend to everyone, great flavor

Very good, very quick, very easy! Not the most interesting dish in the world and I think you could definitely improve it with some technique changes and more complex flavors but this is a great recipe overall!
I didn't have red potatoes, so I used golden potatoes, And ground rosemary. I also used a gallon Ziplock bag to mix it all. Stirred about every 5 min. Turned out great!

I’ve made these following the recipe exactly and they are very good. Now however, I parboil, drain and shake them in the colander to rough them up a bit, then roast. They are very crispy and a huge hit with friends and family.
This is a good base recipe for potatoes. I recommend adding your favorite spices to get them some flavor.
Used fresh taragon instead of rosemary, but turned out awesome. The high heat made the outside crisp while the inside turned out just right
My family and I loved these roasted potatoes. I extended the roasting time to 40 minutes, and they came out crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.
Followed the recipe as written. I found them a little bland.

I bought a bunch of mini red & yellow potatoes & needed a decent side to go with baked salmon. Opted for this one, and it was okay. I’m not sure I would make as written again, though. I feel like it needs some altering. And that being: smaller crisps quicker & larger is more hearty. Cut depending on who you are serving. These need more than 2Tbsp oil. I tossed in all dry seasonings, first. Then drizzled about 3Tbsp olive oil- placed in glass Pyrex 9x13 & sprinkled w/ some Parmesan. At 20 minutes, they were barely heated through. I turned/tossed. Another 10 minutes was key, and that was when I added the sprinkle of extra Parmesan & turned the oven off, but leaving the dish inside to mesh & slowly cool. 

It turned out very well! But, I do suggest modifying the spices to taste, and adding a bit more oil, otherwise you’ll end up with crispy but burnt if you don’t coat thoroughly. These were really good & easy, but I would like to play around with the flavor & cooking method a bit more than as written.
Very quick and easy to make. No way to go wrong, as you can just add whatever seasonings you want in whatever amount you like.

OMG.... I made these for my husband and he (and I) really loved them. I used small red and white potatoes that I had received in my recent MisfitMarket box. What a great way to roast potatoes. We will definitely be doing these again.
Made it exactly as it said. It was great. Wasn’t sure if the kids would like it (they like mashed) but they loved ‘em! Made it twice since.
Terrific - everybody luv'd seasoned spuds !
These potatoes were amazing! I didn't have crushed rosemary, but I did have the regular type and they still tasted amazing. I will definitely make this again!
Easy and absolutely delicious. This is my new potato side dish go-to.

I make these potatoes all the time for my family and they love them. Sometimes I use petite golds which have a buttery flavor. My family, including our grandchildren love them! I use a butter flavored extra virgin olive oil when I bake them. Great recipe.
Delicious and so easy!
This dish was sharing an oven with roast lamb so I cooked it at 225C top shelf initially and then 50min at 180C.
Took a little longer to cook before really done. Used the rosemary, cayenne pepper, and red pepper. Delicious and Easy!

Omg! I’ve been looking for a recipe like this one. I used Greek seasoning salt and herbs that you can get at Costco. Didn’t have tin foil so used parchment paper soooo much better and dried them up with paper towels before seasoning. I didn’t have to turn them half way. Super moist inside crispy outside. I baked them for 30 min at 425. Perfect compliment with chicken, fresh tomatoes and cucumber and let’s not forget home made tzatsiki sauce. Yummy
I used olive oil and added paprika instead of rosemary. They were wonderful!
Fantastic!!

I followed this recipe to the “T”, it turned out to be just what I hoped it would be! I used foil to over the baking sheet, next time I will oil spray the foil before placing the potatoes on it. The potatoes were delicious!
Tasted good but took a lot longer to brown up than I expected.
Easy and worked perfectly. Quartering makes them cook quickly.
very good, added a little Italian seasoning

Super easy side dish to make for pretty much any protein/meat pairing (minus fish probably). Just chopped up some red potatoes, tossed everything into a ziploc, and put them on an aluminum lined pan. Someone recommended NOT to grease the pan in order to get them crispy... so I didn’t. When I flipped them over, they all stuck to the liner! I felt like a dunce lol ALWAYS grease your pans if you’re cooking something like this. If your potatoes don’t come out crispy, I’d recommend turning up the heat in the last 3-5 minutes, and/or making sure every bit is coated in enough oil.
Super easy and tasty recipe. My family loves this!
I love the simplicity of this recipe which allows you to tweak it for you and your family tastes!

Tasty! I did have to bake longer than the recipe stated, but it got a nice, crispy crust and a nice soft inside. I never seem to have good luck getting potatoes crisped, so I was very happy with this recipe - and picky hubby was impressed, too!
Very tasty!

Good! I used half the potatoes, posted amount of the other ingredients except twice the rosemary. I used organic baby golden potatoes that I cut into roughly 1-1.5" pieces because I wasn't sure it would actually bake fast enough. I think it would with bigger pieces just fine, or try the smaller pieces at 15 minutes. Simple, delicious, and fast as promised.
Perfect!

I've made these multiple times exactly according to the recipe and they are great. I'm not a big white potato fan except for French fries, but my family loves them. This recipe is one I'll actually eat--and it's super easy, too. Grease your pan really well because they do stick!

I did not have red potatoes so I just used Irish potatoes and it came out just as good. I also dried the potatoes after I washed them to get the potatoes extra crispy. After I made the potatoes I made a casserole with them with cheese and bacon then popped it back into the oven on 350 degrees for 10 mins
excellent as is or can change it up with different spices!

Turned out nicely, the only thing I might change is baking it for a little long to crisp the potatoes a bit more.
Otherwise, very Yummy!
Cut back on the salt and pepper; and reduced the heat to 425 for my oven. But overall not a bad recipe.
I will make it again but maybe next time i will use less rosemary

With the right spices, these are great served with scrambled eggs for breakfast! I used salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder. Also, toss them with the oil and spices in a Ziploc bag first, then place them on the tray without the excess oil. This will help them be more crispy.
I cooked this for the family I clean for, and they loved it and has asked for me to make this again
It's so simple! No peeling necessary. I used purple potatoes from my daughter's garden.
Loved them, especially dipped in light ranch.
My family really liked this recipe. I just added a couple of cloves of garlic.
I used russet instead of red potatoes. It turned out great. Loved this dish.
Excellent side. Tasted great , will be making these again.

I wanted a roasted potato side that wasn't rich. This was just right. Flavorful, but still on the lighter side for a potato dish. I will make again. 

P.S.
I made the recipe as written. No substitutions. Even pounded out the dried rosemary.
I added a few tablespoons of honey to the oil and rosemary mixture. The honey gave a slight crispness to the roasted potatoes. My new "go to."
This is my go-to recipe for roasted potatoes. Super easy and extremely delicious! Good with any kind of potato!

Yes, I used Yukon Gold Potatoes, 1/2 tsp each - onion and garlic powder, 1/4 tsp Mrs Dash Original, 1 tsp dried chives, 1/4 tsp sweet paprika and replaced the vegetable oil with a extra virgin olive oil-flavored with garlic and basil. I am not permitted to have salt, so I substituted the salt for 1/2 tsp of Nu-Salt (potassium chloride instead of sodium chloride). I like my potatoes a little crispier so I put them back in the oven for an additional 8 minutes. One of the best dishes I have ever made. Can be served with anything, but tonight I am topping it with a cheddar/mozzerella cheese sauce and lightly steamed broccoli florets.

Yes, I used Yukon Gold Potatoes, 1/2 tsp each - onion and garlic powder, 1/4 tsp Mrs Dash Original, 1 tsp dried chives, 1/4 tsp sweet paprika and replaced the vegetable oil with a extra virgin olive oil-flavored with garlic and basil. I am not permitted to have salt, so I substituted the salt for 1/2 tsp of Nu-Salt (potassium chloride instead of sodium chloride). I like my potatoes a little crispier so I put them back in the oven for an additional 8 minutes. One of the best dishes I have ever made. Can be served with anything, but tonight I am topping it with a cheddar/mozzerella cheese sauce and lightly steamed broccoli florets.

Super yummy. Used olive oil and they came out crispy and delicious. I did add a little butter when they came out and tossed them every 5-7 min while in the oven. Mine weren’t an even layer so I had to add an extra 10 min or so cook time. Topped them with a little sour cream (and chives next time) and they were an awesome side dish for our steak dinner tonight. Highly recommend. And sooooo easy. Ty:).
Simple and easy... I cooked it quite a bit longer by accident and they were still awesome!

The trick is in the temperature! This is such an easy and delicious recipe. We have tried to roast potatoes so many times, this is the most awesome one! Btw, we added turkey bacon bits towards the end and roasted the potatoes with it (they cook faster) and since bacon is slightly salty, we skipped the salt.
These taters are bangin! I used peanut oil and it came out perfect!
Tried this tonight using Yukon Golds, the only potatoes I had on hand. Fantastic!
Have now made multiple times. So easy and delicious. This time, made with herb de Provence.....mmmmmm
Very easy and delicious side dish! I added whole cloves of garlic go roast along with the potatoes and it added an extra level of flavor if you are a garlic fan.

I've made these for a couple years but with a little more ingredients!! McCormick web site under rosemary chicken and potato!! Now that the bomb!! You can simply omit the chicken and just do the potatoes!!!
I’ve made these twice. They’ve been a hit both times. Great side dish. Love them.
It takes at least 45 minutes to get the potatoes to be roasted properly!!! Not 20 minutes!!
Very easy and tastes wonderful. Really good with Flat Iron Steak with Mushroom sauce.

I made this on the spur of the moment last night and only had regular baking potatos. Although I added a bit more rosemary, this turned out well. It was the perfect compliment to some grilled leg quarters that I rubbed with a recipe found on Allrecipes, after brining them using a recipe that I found on Allrecipes.

Good recipe but I felt it needed a couple of more spices so I added a little Thyme and some parsley because I love parsley on veggies.. I used the Bermuda onions to use up some left over I had and they tasted great. Used Olive oil to coat them and used a dark baking pan. I had to turn the temperature down to accommodate the baked chicken I cooked at the same time. I used 350 degrees for 25 minutes. The red potatoes browned nicely without burning the carrots and onions (well onions were a little bit too brown). They tasted great and the recipe is so simple!
Added thyme. Even without it, it's great.

I usually make a very similar recipe. I mix my olive oil and spices ingredients in a zip lock baggie and I use Mrs Dash Garlic Herb/No Salt added. Once I place my potatoes on the aluminum foil sheet in the oven, I then sprinkle with dry Ranch salad dressing mix. Also you can mix the ranch into the potatoes mixture, stuff, and rebake. Yumm!
As is, was bland, just tators.
I did 1 tsp Greek seasoning instead of rosemary for a Mediterranean meal. Turned out great!
Easy and delicious. I did however leave them in the oven for 45 minutes instead of the 20 it recommended. Turned out perfect.
Loved it!!!! Super simple
This is a great starting point. I microwave the cut potatoes for 3 mins, then add to flavoring, then low broil for 25-30 minutes. Makes sure insides are creamy, and outsides are brown and crispy.
They were so tasty. I like a lot of spice, so I didn't measure. Just sprinkled it on

These were pretty good. I was out of rosemary, so I substituted tarragon, which isn't comparable in flavor but is still tasty. I also added a light sprinkling of cayenne pepper and a lot of garlic powder because I can't leave well enough alone. :-) The only major change I made was to roast the potatoes another ten minutes or so to make them extra crispy. It might have been due to the fact that I was using a skillet in the oven instead of a thinner roasting pan that the potatoes didn't get as crispy as I wanted after 20 minutes, but I would say, if the potatoes aren't as crispy as you like after 20 minutes, don't be afraid to leave them in for a few more minutes. Thanks for the recipe! I was looking for nice roasted potatoes with minimal fuss, and this fit the bill.
I made this with a bit of vegetables and it looks yummy
Very easy side dish...had all ingredients except red potatoes, only had white. No matter, it was very tasty. I'll definitely make them again with whatever seasonings I have on hand.
Was very good...used ground Rosemary.
Just loved it . Good with anything. Favorite of all men.Make it many times
Easy and very tasty. We both liked this and will definitely make this many more times!
I made modifications to the recipe. I used garlic powder . I've used similar recipes in the past but decided to do something a little different. My family loved it!
Tasty and easy to make.
I love the way the potatoes were made.I'm definitely sure my husband will love them, I added garlic powder and made them more crispy,, salty and a bit of vinegar
Very tasty! A little too salty, though. Next time, I'm definitely decreasing the amount of salt.

I took the advice of another review and added 1/2 tsp Italian seasoning, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, and sprinkled on some parmesan cheese. I think it made it much better than if I had made the recipe as stated. The garlic powder and parmesan were the dominating flavors and made it taste great. We baked it at 450 for 20 minutes as the recipe said, but the potatoes were not cooked at that point (I cut them into roughly 1 and 1/2 inch cubes). I had to turn down the heat to 400, as they were starting to stick to my baking sheet, and let them cook another 10 minutes. They came out perfectly though. I think this recipe on its own would be okay, but you need to tweak it to get a 5 star dish, therefore I'm only giving it 4 stars. Plus the cooking times vary dramatically from review to review, so know your oven and keep a watch on them so you don't over or under cook.
Simple recipe that bakes up quickly and tastes great as a side. My family has asked for it again & again. Nice addition to my recipe file!
No changes and will make it again.
